page.title: 08Dorset & Salisbury Rlwy.
page.content: The Dorset & Salisbury junction Railway runs through part of this block running north to south on the eastern side it enters the block in the NE at GR 087070 and leaves the bloch in the SE at GR 080050 part of the old line runs through the burial mounds at Redmond's Hill. The dismantled railway line was part of the line from Salisbury to West Moors it was opened on the 20th December 1866 as the Dorset & Salisbury Junction Railway but it was also used by the London & South Western Railway.The L&SWR took over completely in 1883. After leaving Alderbury junction the single track line passed through open countryside mostly used for farming.There were 5 stations which were at Downton,Breamore,Fordingbridge ,Daggons Road and Verwood.The line
